business.headline: Do the new labour codes put full-time jobs at risk?Fixed-term jobs just got a major boost under the new labour codes. But does this new flexibility mean full-time roles are at risk, or will companies find a new balance altogether?

India–US trade deal looks quiet. The 'energy' shift tells another storyIndia and the US may look stalled on a formal trade deal, but shifting oil flows, a major LPG pact and calibrated tariff moves show the real progress is happening quietly behind the scenes.
Sensex opens 100 points lower, Nifty below 26,000; Infosys down 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 16.48 points to 84,884.23, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 4.55 points to 25,954.95 as of 9:28 am.

Sudeep Pharma IPO closes today: Is it worth a bid? Check the GMPThe Rs 895-crore IPO includes a fresh issue of Rs 95 crore and an offer for sale worth Rs 800 crore. The price band is set at Rs 563 to Rs 593 per share, and the minimum investment for retail buyers is Rs 14,825.
Apple layoff: Tech giant cuts jobs across sales team, says reportApple said it is reducing roles across its sales teams as part of a plan to improve how it engages with customers.
Sensex closes 331 points lower, Nifty below 26,000; BEL down 3%The S&P BSE Sensex was down 331.21 points to close at 84,900.71, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 108.65 points to end at 25,959.50.

GST 2.0 is lifting consumption. Can it lift Sensex and Nifty too?GST 2.0 has pushed prices down and demand up, but whether that momentum can lift Sensex and Nifty will depend on earnings, capex and global stability in the months ahead.

Tejas crash at Dubai Airshow isolated occurrence: Read HAL's full statementAn Indian Air Force Tejas fighter jet crashed in the United Arab Emirates on Friday while taking part in the Dubai Airshow 2025.

Who is Rama Raju Mantena, pharma king behind Udaipur's star-studded wedding?Rama Raju Mantena is a well-known name in the US pharmaceutical industry. Originally from Vijayawada in Andhra Pradesh, Mantena moved to the United States in the 1980s.
HAL share price falls 4% after Tejas fighter jet crash at Dubai AirshowThe HAL stock slipped to around Rs 4,430, down roughly 3.6% at 10:44 am. Earlier in the day, the stock had tumbled over 8%.

Excelsoft Technologies IPO allotment out: Did you get shares? Check listing detailsExcelsoft Technologies IPO allotment: Applicants who subscribed to the IPO can check their status through the BSE website or the registrar, MUFG Intime India Pvt Ltd.

Sensex, Nifty start week on a positive note as IT stocks lead the chargeBroader market indices were also in the green, mirroring the positive start. The tone was set by IT heavyweights: Tech Mahindra and Infosys jumped over 2% each, followed closely by gains in HCLTech and Wipro. Eicher Motors also featured among the early winners.

TCS suffers legal setback in US with $194 million penalty upheldThe matter has now been sent back to the Northern District of Texas, Dallas Division, which has been asked to review the injunction as per the directions of the Appeals Court.

Why billionaire Lakshmi Mittal is saying goodbye to the UKAs per the Forbes rich list, Mittal has a net worth of $21.4 billion. He is the 12th richest Indian and the 104th richest person in the world.

New labour codes: 10 key changes every employee should knowWhether someone works full-time, on a contract, or in sector-specific roles like media, plantations or factories, the new framework affects nearly everyone. Here are the key updates workers should be aware of, along with several other important changes that haven't received enough attention.

Feel cheated by your family will? Know your legal rightsWhether it is a sudden change in beneficiaries, unequal division of property, or doubts about the person's mental state when the will was written, such situations often create confusion, anger, and emotional stress.

Want to clear your home loan early? Simple ways to pay it off quicklyPay low EMIs and your tenure stretches, increasing your interest costs. Pay higher EMIs, and you could save years and lakhs on the total interest you pay.

New labour codes are here: Will your in-hand salary rise or fall?With the new labour codes now implemented, many employees are trying to understand what it means for their salary structure, especially basic salary, PF deductions and take-home pay.

New labour codes: What changes for paid leave, work hours and health benefitsThe new labour codes apply across sectors and are designed to improve safety, reduce fatigue and make workplaces more predictable for millions of workers in India.

Gratuity in a year? Only if you're a fixed-term employee. Here's what it meansOnly employees hired on fixed-term contracts qualify for the new one-year gratuity rule. Permanent staff remain under the five-year norm, making this benefit exclusive to India's expanding fixed-term workforce.

entertainment.headline: Palak Muchhal visits brother Palash amid wedding postponement with Smriti Mandhana Singer Palak Muchhal was seen at a Mumbai hospital amid reports of her brother Palash Muchhal undergoing medical evaluation. The filmmaker was reportedly admitted following the postponement of his wedding with cricketer Smriti Mandhana.

Robert Pattinson to play negative characters in Dune Part 3, The Odyssey Actor Robert Pattinson is set to appear in three major films releasing in 2026. His roles include a romantic lead, a mythological character, and a villain in a sci-fi epic, signalling a diverse year ahead.

Ameesha Patel recalls Dharmendra's final days, standing by Sunny Deol through it Ameesha Patel shared her memories of Dharmendra and highlighted the need for the Deol family's privacy after the actor's death. She recalled visiting Bollywood's He-Man at the hospital earlier this month and being there for Sunny Deol.

Why Netflix's Stranger Things 5 drops in three parts: Ross Duffer explains Ross Duffer and Netflix confirm the fifth and final season of Stranger Things will launch in three parts over two months, with each volume designed to provide distinct narrative impact.

Upendra on absence of Kannada on Telugu posters in Karnataka: Respect the language Kannada actor Upendra has addressed the controversy surrounding the expectation that Telugu films feature Kannada-language promotional materials in Karnataka, amid ongoing protests by pro-Kannada activists.

Prabhas' Spirit: Ravi Teja's son Mahadhan, Trivikram's son Rishi to assist Vanga Director Sandeep Reddy Vanga's new project 'Spirit', starring Prabhas, brings together the next generation of Telugu film talent as Trivikram Srinivas's son Manoj Rishie and Ravi Teja's son Mahadhan join the direction team.

Dharmendra's love story with ageless romance: Life in a Metro to Rocky Aur Rani Dharmendra's final screen years reiterated a different side of Bollywood's He-Man. In Life in a… Metro and Rocky Aur Rani Kii Prem Kahaani, he explored romance untouched by age or judgment. A new generation discovered love through his roles.

Mass Jathara on OTT: When and where to watch Ravi Teja's mass entertainer Mass Jathara starring Ravi Teja is set for its OTT debut on Netflix in November 2025, following its theatrical release in October. The Telugu film also stars Sreeleela.

Billie Eilish and James Cameron's 3D concert film arrives in theaters March 2026 Paramount Pictures has announced the release of Billie Eilish's 3D concert documentary, co-directed with James Cameron, set to premiere in cinemas in March 2026.

Rupert Grint writes to new Ron Weasley, Alastair Stout, on passing the baton Actor Rupert Grint has sent a supportive letter to Alastair Stout, the new Ron Weasley in HBO's 'Harry Potter' reboot. The series is set to debut on HBO and HBO Max in 2027.

Chiranjeevi surprises Anil Ravipudi with a stylish watch on his birthday Chiranjeevi marked director Anil Ravipudi's birthday with a thoughtful present while they continued work on their upcoming film, which is scheduled for release during the Sankranthi festival. The film sees Nayanthara and Venkatesh in pivotal roles, adding to the anticipation among fans.

Ranbir Kapoor to cameo in Prabhas, Sandeep Reddy Vanga's Spirit: Report Sandeep Reddy Vanga's 'Spirit' has started filming featuring Prabhas as the lead. Ranbir Kapoor will reportedly make a cameo appearance in the film.

Destined With You actor Jo Bo-ah pregnant with first child Actor Jo Bo-ah is expecting her first child, according to an announcement made by her agency, XYZ Studio, on November 25. The news follows media reports about her pregnancy, with the agency thanking fans for their ongoing support and requesting privacy regarding further details.

Alia Bhatt mourns Dharmendra, calls him a legend who lit up every frame Alia Bhatt mourned the death of Bollywood actor Dharmendra, underlining his impact on Indian cinema. She shared screen space with the actor in the 2023 film 'Rocky Aur Rani Kii Prem Kahaani'.

Watch: Mohan Babu gives Rajinikanth a tour of his house and charitable trust Rajinikanth visited Hyderabad to celebrate Mohan Babu's 50 years in cinema. The two have been best friends for five decades.

South Korean actor Lee Soon-jae dies at 91 Veteran South Korean actor Lee Soon-jae has died aged 91. His passing marks the end of a monumental career that shaped Korean television and theatre culture.

Kim Kardashian's All's Fair renewed for season 2 at Hulu The first season of Ryan Murphy's 'All's Fair' has attracted widespread notice for its ensemble cast, provocative script, and depiction of female attorneys challenging traditional power dynamics in the legal world.

When Dharmendra booked 100 rooms for Hema Malini ahead of Esha Deol's birth Dharmendra made a grand but thoughtful gesture to protect Hema Malini's privacy during her pregnancy. This act highlights the depth of their enduring love.

Vijay Sethupathi joins Silambarasan-Vetri Maaran's Arasan. Official announcement out Actor Vijay Sethupathi has joined director Vetri Maaran's upcoming film 'Arasan'. The film, starring Silambarasan in the lead, is part of the 'Vada Chennai' universe, sparking high fan expectations.

general news.headline: You're misfit for secular Army: Supreme Court upholds Christian officer's dismissalThe officer had challenged the disciplinary action, arguing that being compelled to enter the temple violated his religious freedom, but the Supreme Court ruled that his conduct amounted to disobedience of a lawful command.
Zubeen Garg's death plain murder, motive will shock Assam: Himanta SarmaZubeen Garg's death plain murder, motive will shock Assam: Himanta Sarma

Handles being run from Pak? X's location feature stirs political storm in IndiaX's new feature, which displays the region in which an account is based, has triggered a controversy in India. Several politically active accounts, especially those critical of the government, have been found to be based outside the country, giving BJP ammo to attack the opposition.

2nd Test Day 4 Live: SA in control with 508-run lead at lunchIndia vs South Africa live score 2nd Test Day 4 Updates: South Africa hold all the cards with Tristan Stubbs and Wiaan Mulder going strong with a 42-run stand as the Proteas lead by 508 runs with lunch being taken. India finds itself in a spot of bother, and it remains to be seen if the visitors will declare and get a move on in this contest.

Next up: More Aadhaar in our lives because we don't have enough of it alreadyThe government is planning a fresh push for Aadhaar in offline use and chances are that soon you may have to show it even while entering a restaurant or a housing society.

Wounds of centuries are healing today: PM at Ram Mandir after flag hoisting Live UpdatesThe Dhwajarohan, or flag hoisting atop the Ram Mandir, marked the formal completion of the temple complex, six years after the Supreme Court's landmark 2019 Ayodhya verdict that allotted the entire 2.77-acre disputed site for the shrine.

A tale of two handshakes: The Modi-Nitish resetFor years, the shadow of Narendra Modi and Nitish Kumar's handshake in Ludhiana remained a prime factor in the country's politics in general and Bihar politics in particular. But much water has flown down the Ganga since then.

Palak Muchhal visits brother Palash amid wedding postponement with Smriti MandhanaSinger Palak Muchhal was seen at a Mumbai hospital amid reports of her brother Palash Muchhal undergoing medical evaluation. The filmmaker was reportedly admitted following the postponement of his wedding with cricketer Smriti Mandhana.

Tata Sierra launched at Rs 11.49 lakh: Nostalgic SUV revived with modern techTata Motors has launched the iconic Sierra in a modern, premium avatar for 2025, blending classic design cues with advanced technology, fresh powertrains and a feature-rich, safety-focused package.

Cyclone Senyar may form in 48 hours, southern states brace for heavy rainIMD says a well-marked low over the Bay of Bengal may intensify into a cyclonic storm within 48 hours. Heavy rain is forecast across Tamil Nadu, Kerala, Lakshadweep, Andaman & Nicobar, and Andhra Pradesh.

Boy, 6, mauled by neighbour's pitbull, ear torn off, horror caught on cameraA six-year-old boy suffered grievous injuries after being mauled by a neighbour's pitbull in northwest Delhi's Prem Nagar. The attack, captured on CCTV, resulted in the child losing his right ear.

Satellite captures Ethiopia's Hayli Gubbi volcano's mega eruptionThe India Meteorological Department (IMD) reported that ash clouds from this eruption are now moving eastward towards China and will clear Indian skies by 7:30 pm on Tuesday.

Dharmendra's love story with ageless romance: Life in a Metro to Rocky Aur RaniDharmendra's final screen years reiterated a different side of Bollywood's He-Man. In Life in a… Metro and Rocky Aur Rani Kii Prem Kahaani, he explored romance untouched by age or judgment. A new generation discovered love through his roles.
From Serenity to Celebration - Gujarat in All Its ShadesAnother destination that has stood the test of time and modernisation is Vadnagar.

Do the new labour codes put full-time jobs at risk?Fixed-term jobs just got a major boost under the new labour codes. But does this new flexibility mean full-time roles are at risk, or will companies find a new balance altogether?

Why India's homegrown cloud kitchens are booming without delivery appsInstead of automated chatbots, doesn't the food ordering experience feel better when you're talking to a real person, customising your order as per your preferences, and getting that personal touch? This human connection is one of the key reasons why cloud kitchens are becoming so popular.

Diljit Dosanjh's iEmmy look proves that menswear bling can be subtle, and stunningAnd while the International Emmy Awards nomination is historic, Diljit Dosanjh's appearance on the red carpet sparked just as much interest.

Bride's father nails slow-mo steps, glass slide move at sangeet in viral dance videoThe video, shared with the text overlay "POV: When the bride's father dances like that, toh sangeet toh hit hona hi thaa" shows him dancing to Bezubaan Phir Se on the stage.

The story of Surekha Yadav, India's first woman loco pilotSurekha Yadav became Asia's first female locomotive pilot in 1988, breaking barriers in a male-dominated field. Her journey continues to inspire women across India to pursue careers in STEM and technical roles.

It's not just the bride and groom, families feel the wedding jitters tooEvery bride and groom aspires to have the perfect wedding. One that fits their dreamy aesthetics, one that tells their story in their own way. And all that comes with a lot of pressure, physical and mental, and not just the couple, the families too go through the wedding stress.

Guru Tegh Bahadur, who sacrificed life calmly, fought Mughal forces fiercely at 13Guru Tegh Bahadur's laying down his life in 1675 to defend religious freedom remains one of history's most profound sacrifices. On his 350th martyrdom anniversary, the Ninth Sikh Guru who earned the title of Hind di Chadar, is remembered for standing firm against religious persecution and forced conversions under Aurangzeb.

Lawyer complains of sore throat during hearing. Here's what Chief Justice saidDuring the hearing, senior advocate Gopal Sankaranarayanan said, "Sorry, I cannot speak properly. My throat is gone." In response, Chief Justice of India Surya Kant responded, "In Delhi, that's a problem for everyone currently," a veiled reference to the city's toxic air crisis.

Video: Main entrance damaged, customers use ladder to enter SBI branch in OdishaAs the main entry point of the bank was damaged, the bank authorities and the local residents placed the ladder on a trolley as an alternative pathway.

The filmmaker was reportedly admitted following the postponement of his wedding with cricketer Smriti Mandhana.

sports.headline: Can India chase over 450 in Guwahati? Here's what Test history suggests IND vs SA, 2nd Test: India face a daunting, world-record chase in the final innings to avoid losing the Test series at home. South Africa's commanding lead and disciplined batting have piled on the pressure, with no team ever having chased 400-plus in Asia.

Thorpe's widow claims late cricketer would be alive if England cricket helped Graham Thorpe's widow believes the late England batter would still be alive today had he received better support from the cricketing world after leaving the national setup.

Gambhir can say whatever he wants, I don't care: Srikkanth slams Test selection Former India captain Kris Srikkanth criticised Gautam Gambhir for inconsistent Test team selections. His comments come after Indian batters failed in the first innings of the Guwahati Test after South Africa posted 489.

Hazlewood back in training, Cummins trains with pink ball before 2nd Test Josh Hazlewood and Pat Cummins took part in a crucial training session in Sydney on Tuesday as Australia stepped up their preparations for the second Ashes Test at the Gabba.

India set to formally get hosting rights of Commonwealth Games on November 26 India is set to be formally approved as host of the 2030 Commonwealth Games on Wednesday. Ahmedabad will stage the centenary edition, strengthening India's bid to host the 2036 Olympics.

Ashes: Usman Khawaja's golf post sparks fresh debate amid injury row Veteran Australian opener Usman Khawaja has reignited debate over his Ashes preparations after sharing a photo from a golf course on Instagram, just days after enduring a challenging first Test in Perth.

No place for Ruturaj: Ex-India cricketer tips Jaiswal to open with Rohit in SA ODIs Former India batter Aakash Chopra welcomed Ruturaj Gaikwad's recall to India's ODI squad for the upcoming South Africa series, but predicted Yashasvi Jaiswal will be Rohit Sharma's opening partner. Chopra also raised concerns about Nitish Kumar Reddy's role and utilisation in the squad.

Man United deserved to lose: Amorim wishes his side had shown Everton's fight Ruben Amorim conceded that Manchester United are still some distance from competing with the Premier League's leading sides after their 1-0 defeat to 10-man Everton on Monday.

Washington Sundar breaks silence on flexible batting position in India's Test side India all-rounder Washington Sundar said he is happy to bat wherever the team needs him, adding that he enjoys taking on different roles whenever required.

India vs Pakistan set for February 15 in T20 World Cup 2026: Report India and Pakistan will face each other on February 15, 2026, at the R Premadasa Stadium in Colombo during the Men's T20 World Cup. India and Pakistan are expected to be grouped with the USA, Netherlands and Namibia during the tournament as the full schedule will be revealed on Tuesday, November 25.

India and Pakistan are expected to be grouped with the USA, Netherlands and Namibia during the tournament as the full schedule will be revealed on Tuesday, November 25.

Pace, bounce and chaos: Jansen's hostile spell wrecks India in Guwahati TestMarco Jansen was at his devastating best on Day 3 of the second Test in Guwahati, delivering a menacing spell of 6 for 48. The left-arm quick rolled back the years as he peppered India with a relentless barrage of bouncers, forcing the batters into submission and dragging the hosts to their knees.

2nd Test Day 4 Live: SA in control with 508-run lead at lunchIndia vs South Africa live score 2nd Test Day 4 Updates: South Africa hold all the cards with Tristan Stubbs and Wiaan Mulder going strong with a 42-run stand as the Proteas lead by 508 runs with lunch being taken. India finds itself in a spot of bother, and it remains to be seen if the visitors will declare and get a move on in this contest.

BCCI's domestic promise seems all talk: India's batting letdown in Guwahati proves itIndia's collapse in Guwahati has reignited questions about the BCCI's commitment to domestic cricket. Despite strong Ranji performers waiting in the wings, India's selection strategy leans heavily on youth, leaving the team exposed to another home Test whitewash.

Virat Kohli's winning mentality lacking in this India Test side: Former wicketkeeperIND vs SA: Sreevats Goswami believes India are missing the winning edge Virat Kohli once brought to Test cricket. As results dip at home, the absence of that mindset is becoming harder to ignore.

Smriti Mandhana removes wedding posts as plans put on hold after father's health scareSmriti Mandhana's wedding celebrations were halted after a sudden health scare involving her father. As the family focuses on recovery, the Indian star has removed all related posts from her social media.

India women win 2nd successive Kabaddi World Cup title, PM Modi sends wishesIndian women's kabaddi team won their second successive World Cup title in Dhaka. PM Modi said the victory will inspire future generations to take up the sport.

Gautam Gambhir and the Kamasutra of chaos: When Indian team lost its positionIND vs SA: Gautam Gambhir's obsession with constant change has turned Indian cricket into his personal Kamasutra of experimental positions, endless adjustments, and zero satisfaction. The result? Confusion disguised as innovation.

Medvedev-Bopanna and Nagal-Monfils team up for World Tennis League in DecemberThe World Tennis League returns in December with a fresh venue and a star-studded line-up. With Medvedev, Bopanna, Kyrgios, Monfils and Nagal in action, four days of high-quality tennis await.

Smriti Mandhana removes wedding posts as plans put on hold after father's health scareSmriti Mandhana's wedding celebrations were halted after a sudden health scare involving her father. As the family focuses on recovery, the Indian star has removed all related posts from her social media.

Broad on viral reaction after Root's dismissal: Every England fan felt like thatFormer England bowler Stuart Broad opened up on his viral reaction to Joe Root's dismissal in the Ashes Test. Broad's reaction went viral on social media as he was in utter disbelief watching England collapse on Day 2 in Perth.

IND vs SA: Dale Steyn tears into Rishabh Pant for 'brainfade' shot in GuwahatiRishabh Pant faced heavy criticism for his reckless shot during Day 3 of the second Test against South Africa. Dale Steyn and Anil Kumble said that Pant needs to show more responsibility to help India recover in the series.

Washington Sundar urges faith as India struggle in Guwahati Test: Gotta stay positiveIND vs SA: Washington Sundar asked the team and fans to stay positive despite India's struggles in Guwahati. Backing intent over outcomes, he stressed that belief in plans and players remains crucial in difficult moments.

Washington Sundar defends Pant, Jurel after India's batting implosion in GuwahatiIND vs SA: Washington Sundar defended Rishabh Pant and Dhruv Jurel after India's collapse in Guwahati. While execution failed, he insisted the intent was right as South Africa tightened their grip on the Test.

Mumbai Smashers land Quang Duong; Lucknow Leopards take India's Aditya RuhelaWorld No. 3 Quang Duong and India No.1 Aditya Ruhela headlined the inaugural Indian Pickleball League Draft, as all six teams assembled squads for the country's first MYAS-recognised professional pickleball league.

Pakistan overturns life ban on Arshad Nadeem's coach after due-process violationsPakistan Sports Board adjudicator Pervez Rashid has overturned the life ban on Arshad Nadeem's coach Salman Butt, calling the PAAF's action unconstitutional and lacking due process, clearing him to continue guiding the Olympic champion.

Marco Jansen does a Shaun Pollock in Guwahati Test: All-rounder reveals inspirationIND vs SA: Marco Jansen produced a match-defining all-round performance in Guwahati and revealed that Shaun Pollock is his biggest inspiration. The young South African is steadily carving a path to become a complete all-rounder for his country.

Delhi-born Chaudhary becomes first Indian in 21st century to domestic ton Down UnderDelhi-born Nikhil Chaudhary smashed a maiden first-class ton for Tasmania, becoming the first Indian this century to hit a Sheffield Shield hundred as his 163 powered the Tigers to a commanding position against NSW.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
